org.nodex.java.core

Interface Future<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Deferred<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlockingAction, DeferredAction, SimpleAction, SimpleFuture, SynchronousAction

    public interface Future<T>

    Represents an operation that may or may not have completed yet.

    It contains methods to determine it it has completed, failed or succeded, and allows a handler to be set which will be called when the operation completes, or fails.

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean complete()
      This will return true if the operation has completed, or failed.
      java.lang.Exception exception()
      Returns the exception.
      boolean failed()
      Did the operation fail?
      Future<T> handler(CompletionHandler<T> handler)
      Set a handler on the Future.
      T result()
      Returns the result of the operation.
      boolean succeeded()
      Has the operation succeeded?

    • Method Detail

      • result

        T result()
        Returns the result of the operation. If the operation has not yet completed, or if it failed it will return null.

      • exception

        java.lang.Exception exception()
        Returns the exception. An exception is always set if the operation failed. If the operation has not yet completed, or if it succeeded it will return null.

      • complete

        boolean complete()
        This will return true if the operation has completed, or failed.

      • succeeded

        boolean succeeded()
        Has the operation succeeded?

      • failed

        boolean failed()
        Did the operation fail?

      • handler

        Future<T> handler(CompletionHandler<T> handler)
        Set a handler on the Future. If the operation has already completed it will be called immediately, otherwise it will be called when the operation completes or fails, passing in a reference to this.
